Fields.DialogueText: It might be a little weird, but this fuel really works!
We've been going non-stop on such a small amount, and am I crazy or are we actually going faster than usual?
You're not crazy. What do you think is in this stuff?
Your guess is as good as mine.

Fields.MenuText: I'm thinking it's made of some kind of space plant or something.
It's made of... science!
Then your guess must not be very good, because I've got nothing.

Fields.DialogueText: Space plant, huh? I'm not too sure about that, but it's not a horrible guess. It just needs a little more work.
Well, I guess you're... technically right. Though I'm sure there's a quite bit more to it than that.
I'm working on it. I'm taking notes of all my observations. I'll figure it out before long.
I'm sure you'll figure it out eventually. And I'll be here to celebrate when you do.
It sounds like we've got Morganas.
Should we take care of them or just speed right past them?
We're already here. We might as well deal with them. It shouldn't take long anyway.
@BATTLE
Then let's go!
You look down.
No, not really. It's just...
*sigh* I wish we could've stayed longer.

Fields.MenuText: Me too.
I'm glad we're gone. It got old fast.
We'll be back before long.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Then maybe we can turn back really quick and just pick up a few souvenirs.
You have to be joking! How can you resist China's charms?
I'll keep my fingers crossed.
You're really not homesick at all?
Not really. I mean... I guess. I just haven't thought about it too much.
Too busy having fun?
It's not fun. What we're doing is important.
I agree. I also think you're having fun.
Okay, maybe I'm having fun too.
*ALARM*
Morganas.
Already? Didn't we just deal with some?
Captain, that was a ways back. We've traveled quite a distance since our last encounter.
Huh, really? I guess this new fuel is messing with me. Maybe the thrill of a fight will get my head back on straight.
@BATTLE
Hermes.
I know, I wasn't being serious.
Hermes, what are you doing down here?
I'm getting ready to refuel the engine. It seems that the faster we move, the faster it burns.
Isn't that someone else's job?
Yeah, but Jeffrey said I could play with it- erm, I mean examine it, while he was on break.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, so you're testing it.
As long as you're not blowing up the ship, I'm happy.
Have you noticed anything interesting?

Fields.DialogueText: Not really. I'm more marking down observations.
I know better than that, Captain. Besides, I'm not even sure this concoction is flammable. I mean, it probably is, since it's fuel, but I won't be certain until I watch it burn.
Hmmm... honestly, yes and no.
What have you noticed about it?
The smell. A mixture like this should have some kind of smell, good or bad, but I can't smell anything. And don't even get me started on the taste.
Excuse me?
*ALARM*
Crap, Morganas. I guess I'll have to finish this later.
Wait, did you say you tasted this sludge? It's fuel, not food!
@BATTLE
Oh, Captain, here you are!
My office wasn't the first place you looked for me?
I needed to tell someone about Jeffrey and I know I can trust you to keep it on the hush-hush.
Hush-hush? Who's Jeffrey again?
Jeffrey. Officer Reynolds. He works with the engines. He's the guy keeping the new fuel from burning a hole through the ship. Anyway, I was talking with Sarah and-
A hole through the ship?
Don't worry about it, it's under control. We're talking about Sarah now.
You mean another person I don't know?
You don't know? *sigh* Officer McDonald. How do I know your crew better than you?

Fields.MenuText: I know my crew just fine. Just not big on first names in a professional context.
I'm sure I know them as well as they know me.
You're more of a people person.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you still know my name.
So not at all?
Well, you're not wrong there. I do love people. They can be so fun and interesting.
Oh, I'm sensing Morganas approaching from the west. I'll go sound the alarms.
Wait a minute, what did you come in here to tell me?
Oh, she met someone when we made port and now she's totally over him.
Wha... Poor Jeffrey.
@BATTLE
Of course I do, energetic Belle with wings.
Not funny.
*shrugs* I don't know. Maybe.
Hey, Hermes, what are you doing back here?
Nothing, really. I was just watching our wake.
How much faster than normal do you think we're going now?

Fields.MenuText: I don't think we're going that much faster, are we?
Well, we might need to change the ship's name to Lightning.
If you really want to know, why don't we check the helm?

Fields.DialogueText: We're moving significantly faster. I'm surprised it isn't more obvious to you.
Heh, give Hermes a little more credit. He was pretty fast too.
I already did. I know the mathematical answer. It just doesn't seem enough to me.
I'm sure if we give it some time this speed will seem perfectly normal.
I hope not. If it does, it'll feel like we're moving at a snail's pace when we switch back to normal fuel.
Do we have to switch back?
Hermes, are you suggesting we just never turn in the fuel? You want to just keep it all for ourselves?
Maaaaaaybe.
*ALARM*
Oh, it sounds like the Morganas heard you. Now they're here to punish you.
We'll see who ends up punished.
@BATTLE
Just tell the electricians to prioritize it. It feels like the entire radio room is one big fire hazard right now.
Yes, Captain.
Captain, do you have a moment?

Fields.MenuText: I've got a bad feeling about this.
Sure, what's up?
I'm a little busy, but if you're quick, sure.

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't. This is a completely innocent visit. Without any ulterior motives.
Not much. I just wanted to say hi.
Don't worry, This won't take long at all.
Guys, get in here.
Uhhh, Hermes, what's all this?
Captain, I'd like to introduce you to William, Craig, Elise, John, and Cara.
Yeah, I, uh, I recognize members of my crew. Is there a reason they're here?
They just wanted to say hi.
All right, guys, now go and get the next set and bring them in.
Hermes, I see what you're doing. Do we really have time for this?
Sure, it's lunch time.
I know my crew just fine.
You might think that, but can you name one of the five officers that just left?
Slim, Twitch, Sunshine, Mad Dog and Rosey?
That's what I'm talking about. I want you to stop seeing them as just nameless officers. They're people with interests and lives. They matter. Names matter.
*ALARM*
I hear you, okay, but can this wait until after we deal with the Morganas?
Okay, but don't think I'm letting this go.
I know better than to think that.
@BATTLE
Hmmmm... So she tasted this, huh?
Yuck, it looks like chicken noodle motor oil.
Just a quick taste can't hurt. I mean, she's fine, right?
Captain, stop! What are you doing?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing. I'm just... patrolling?
I was curious. You said you tasted it, right?
A little lick never hurt anyone.

Fields.DialogueText: Patrolling? That's what you're going with?
I'm a Belle. We can handle things that could be dangerous for you.
One lick is how it starts, then before you know it you're in the alley begging without a tongue.
If I hadn't walked in right now, would you have seriously tried that?
I... think so. Curiosity is a strong force.
Well, don't be curious. I was just messing with you.
What? You were... you were messing with me?
Yeah, just, you know... a little joke.
*ALARM*
You're not very funny, you know that?
I'm hilarious!
@BATTLE
What?
Long story.
This voyage has just flown by, right, Captain?
Yeah, I actually think we're already about halfway there.
Already? And we haven't needed to resupply once? I love this new fuel. I really do.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe keeping it for ourselves wouldn't be the worst idea.
Hopefully our scientists and engineers will figure out how to mass produce it.
It's still a little too dangerous for my tastes.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, you know I was only joking about that, don't you?
That's the dream. We need every advantage over the Morganas that we can get.
What's life without a little danger every now and then?
Captain, we've got Morganas inbound from the south.
Sound the alarm.
Ahem.
Sound the alarm, Twitch.
Um, I'm Craig.
Just sound the alarm.
Smooth.
You'll remember I called him Twitch before, too. You've got to give me points for consistency.
Oh, God. You actually did, didn't you?
Underestimate me at your peril, Hermes.
@BATTLE
Just leave me with my fantasies for another three or four seconds.
*ALARM*
Turn off those alarms. We just took care of the Morganas.
Not all of them. We've got more inbound.

Fields.MenuText: Did they call for help?
How many are there?
Can we take them?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think so. I think these ones just showed up at the same time.
Just a handful. We're not facing an army.
Knowing us? Probably.
Hmph. Why don't we take advantage of our new speed?
Are you suggesting what I think you're suggesting?
I'm suggesting we put our ship into overdrive and see if we can get fast enough to avoid an unnecessary battle. It'd be a good experiment.
What have I said about experimenting with our lives?
Nothing. Nothing I can remember, at least.
Let's compromise. We'll take care of them, then go as fast as possible.
Fine, but we'd better go really fast.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're finally living our best possible lives!
You're sure this is safe? Aren't we going to be using a lot of fuel going this fast?
From what I can tell, it's actually safer this way.
What do you mean?
We only really seem to run into Morganas when we're slowing down. They attack at greater frequencies when we've changed out fuel or taken turns.

Fields.MenuText: And you didn't think to share this information earlier?
Whatever you say. I trust you in all these scientific matters.
You sure? It seems like we're running into more Morganas than usual.

Fields.DialogueText: It's just a hypothesis. I'm not certain on anything yet.
As you should. I'm smarter than I look.
Hmmm, maybe. I've been a little too preoccupied to notice.
So, correct me if I'm wrong, but you're saying that as long as we're moving this fast we shouldn't run into Morganas?
Not exactly. We can still run into them directly.
You mean...
Bow first.
Nope.
I'm at least 40% sure I can survive it with my superstructure intact, Captain.
You know I'm going to have to make you cut back on the new fuel if I think it's making you crazy, right?
I'll be good.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Well, we managed to avoid running aground.
Barely.
Okay, maybe going top speed in relatively shallow waters wasn't the best idea I've ever had.

Fields.MenuText: You think?
You've had worse. I mean, at least this one worked.
It was a good idea, just with unforeseen consequences.

Fields.DialogueText: Pffft, you don't have to be a jerk about it.
Hey, all my ideas work. Just sometimes in unexpected ways.
Yes... unforeseen. Who could have known something like that? Heh... heh heh.
From now on, let's just keep to a more manageable speed. It's nice to be able to correct course gradually.
Plus there's being able to stop before our next collision.
Yeah. But don't say "next collision" like it's inevitable.
I always plan for the worst outcome. It's more fun that way.
*ALARM*
Speaking of fun.
Fighting Morganas is not my idea of fun, Captain.
All the more reason to get rid of them fast. Then you can get back to your yucky ooze.
One person's ooze is another Belle's treasure.
@BATTLE
Uh, Hermes, what are you eating?
Hmmm? Just some soup.
Wait. Were you worried it was the fuel or something?
Maybe a little, but that actually looks pretty good.
It's my favorite. I had the ingredients picked up before we left China. Want to try some?
Sure, I'll try a spoonful.
Open up... How is it?
It's... interesting. It kind of tastes like chicken, actually.
It's shark fin soup.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, huh, that explains the texture. Not bad.
Bleh, nope. I'm out of here.
I think I might have just found a new favorite meal.

Fields.DialogueText: If you mean "delicious," then yes, it's not bad.
Hey, don't spit it out! That's such a waste.
Well, don't get any ideas. I'm not going to share all of mine with you.
*ALARM*
Better finish your shark fast. We've got something more dangerous to defeat.
Hmmm, Morgana fin soup... nah, that doesn't sound good at all.
Not everything can turn into soup.
@BATTLE
Hermes?
Over here!
How often am I going to find you down here?
I have to spend most of my time down here. At the rate we're going, we'll be in the UK before we know it.

Fields.MenuText: And you want to learn everything you can about this stuff before you get there?
Don't you have some messages you're supposed to be looking after?
And you've made friends with the ooze, and you're going to miss it when it's gone?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. You know me too well, Captain.
They're in a safe place. I'm not losing any this time.
No... not really. We're more acquaintances than anything.
There are just so many mysteries about this stuff. I'm too curious to leave it alone and just hand it over.
It's fuel. What's so mysterious about it?
You know what it's made of?
No.
How about how the Chinese made it?
Above my pay grade, apparently. I assume they're trying to leverage it against the Japanese, but...
Or, my favorite, why did they give it to us with no information about it besides that it's fuel?
Okay, I get it. There are some mysteries here.
Exactly. That's why I'm using any free time I find to try and unravel them.
*ALARM*
It looks like that free time just flew right out the window.
Don't rub it in. Let's just go.
@BATTLE
Thomas.
Officer Levinson.
Good. How about Elise?
Roberts. I do know the names, Hermes.
With maybe one or two exceptions. I mean, if they're really unremarkable.
Mhmmmm.
I'm surprised you're still doing this.
What do you mean? I told you I want you to know your crew as individuals.
I thought you were using all your free time to study our new fuel.
Oh, well, I'll always have time for you, Captain. Even if I have to spend it lightly torturing you.

Fields.MenuText: There's nothing light about it.
This is far from torture. You're always a pleasure to be around, Hermes.
At least it's coming from a good place. You just want me to be a better captain.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to see real torture, I can go grab my whip.
Well, Captain, you sure know how to compliment a girl. But don't think I'm going to start going easy on you.
Exactly. I'm glad you can see that, Captain. Now, next question.
Captain, Morganas are approaching us from astern.
Thank you, Elise. Sound the alarm.
Um, okay, you're welcome, Captain?
Very good, Captain.
I still reserve the right to think of her as Sunshine.
@BATTLE
I think you're bluffing.
You wanna try me?
I wouldn't dream of it.
Hey, Hermes, what's going on?
Hey, Cap.
Hermes, what are you doing?
Oh, I'm just going to dilute some of the fuel so I can perform some small scale tests on it.
Sounds good. Is there a reason you're doing this in my quarters?
Hmm? Oh, Jeffrey went on break. It got a little lonely down there all by myself.
Oh, well, you're always welcome here.

Fields.MenuText: I like the company too.
Just don't get any of that stuff on the floor. I wouldn't want it to stain. Or disintegrate.
Just try and keep it down. I've got work to do.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear that. I was worried I'd be an annoyance.
Don't worry, I brought towels. A whopping load of 'em.
Oh, of course, sorry. I'll just be here, in this corner.
*ALARM*
Yeah, I guess it has been a while since we ran into any Morganas.
I better put this stuff back below deck.
Nah, it's fine. You can leave it up here. This shouldn't take long, right?
Not if we put our all into this.
Sounds like a plan.
@BATTLE
Hermes, you look... preoccupied.
Hermes?
Sorry, sorry! But Captain, look, to the northeast!

Fields.MenuText: Is that what I think it is?
Home sweet home.
Huh, a flock of seagulls. Neat.

Fields.DialogueText: It's the UK! We're back home!
It'd be sweeter if I could figure out what was in that fuel.
You're so easily distracted, Captain. If you look past the birds you'll see home. We're back.
I still can't believe how fast that experimental fuel got us here.
I know what you mean. We wouldn't have gotten halfway here yet on the normal stuff.
There're still no ill effects on the ship? It hasn't devoured the hull yet?
No. As far as I can tell, we're actually doing better than ever. Jeffrey says it's running like new.
It almost sounds too good to be true.
I know. I'm looking forward to reporting my findings.
You know when we get there we'll have to turn over all the fuel we have left.
Ugh, don't remind me.
*ALARM*
See, that's what you get when you make me groan.
Yes, your groans control the Morganas.
I wish.
@BATTLE
It's okay. I still think it's cute.
Do you really?
Hey, Hermes, you in here?
Hey, Captain, what's up?
What is that huge stack of papers? Are you writing a book?
No, I'm just writing my report on the engine and the fuel. Oh, and the explosive. I can't forget about that.
A report?

Fields.MenuText: I hadn't realized you'd been ordered to be so... comprehensive. I almost feel bad about just signing off on the other reports.
It must be a really detailed report.
What's there to write? Bomb went boom, engine went fast, and fuel attracted Morganas. Pretty straight forward.

Fields.DialogueText: No, I'm doing this voluntarily. And sure, you could do this too if you wanted, but you don't have to.
I try to note all my thoughts along every step of our trip. It helps to write notes.
There's a little more to it than that, but yes, that's kind of the synopsis.
So I take it you're busy with all that?
Did you need something?
Actually, I was hoping you could teach me how to make that soup you let me try before.
Really?
Yeah, I haven't been able to get the taste out of my mind. I'm kind of craving it.
*ALARM*
I'll make time to teach you as soon as we shake off these Morganas.
Sounds like a deal.
@BATTLE
Welcome back, Hermes. I trust your journey went well.
It went phenomenally. Better than I could've expected.
Oh, really?

Fields.MenuText: She's telling the truth. Everything worked better than expected.
Honestly, I was expecting something to blow up.
I expected better. We didn't quite hit the speed of sound.

Fields.DialogueText: The fuel in particular worked like a charm.
But nothing did. Nothing. Well, except the bomb. That one was supposed to blow up.
Well, you're the one that wanted us to slow down.
It's good to hear everything went smoothly. Now, I believe you have a delivery for me?
Oh, well, here are the letters from China. And this is my report on all the experiments, the engine, bomb, and the fuel.
And where is the actual fuel?
That's going to take a little while. We actually have quite a bit left over.
That's good to hear. The more the merrier. For now, I'll be on my way with these messages. I'll send some men to unload the fuel soon.
We'll be here.
Until we get new orders, anyway.
Captain, we've got Morganas in the area.
Are they approaching?
They seem to be.
We've got no time to waste, then. Let's go.
@BATTLE
It was slow down or slam into Morganas face first.
Captain, permission to set a new course?
I assume there's a reason.
Radio room reports an SOS from the north. Fishing vessel under Morgana pursuit.

Fields.MenuText: How far out of our way are they?
You're sure it's not a trap?
Then I guess we got here just in time.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, what kind of question is that? We've got to help them. We need to protect them from the Morganas.
It might be. But that shouldn't stop us.
That's my captain!
Do we know anything about their status? The ship's?
It doesn't look good.
Then let's hurry. We don't have any time to waste.
@BATTLE
We did a good thing, Captain.
You're right, we did. But that's just one ship, Hermes. We can't save everyone.
Challenge accepted.
That wasn't a-
I will protect everyone. Nobody need fear the Morgana threat while I'm around.
With that kind of spirit, I'm pretty sure she could do anything.
You restock the ammo, William. And you can grab more fuel, Jeffrey, but don't let me catch you slacking off with Sarah. She needs to get more food.
Okay, now you're just showing off.
Maybe a little. But it's a good thing, right?
Yeah, I'm glad you're finally seeing your crew as people.

Fields.MenuText: You know I always did, right? It's always fun to mess with you, but this isn't really going to change how I act as captain.
If I see them all as family, I'll care that much more about all of us coming out of this fight alive.
What are you going to teach me next? How to dance, maybe?

Fields.DialogueText: That's fine. You were already a pretty good captain.
Exactly. I don't want you to die. I don't want anyone to die.
Well, first I'd have to learn how to dance. And trust me, that's a lost cause.
You know, it occurs to me that just because I know the crew better, it doesn't mean they know me better.
Hmmm, you make a decent point. I know you pretty well. Should I start some rumors about you and spread them through the ship?
What? No, that sounds like a horrible plan.
I'd only spread good things. Trust me.
That smile. That one right there is hard to trust.
Fine, I'll prove it. Oh, Elise! Guess what I just heard about the Captain!
Where are Morganas when you need them?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Captain, you need to see this.
You look serious. What's going on?
Look, just on the horizon.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, a storm's coming through.
Is that an... island?
That can't be...

Fields.DialogueText: Look again. That's more than a storm.
Yes, it's a moving island. And it's coming closer.
You should be right, but somehow you're wrong.
It's a tidal wave of Morganas.
They're heading right for us.
It's more than that, Captain. I think they're riding our wake to get here.
So what, we lead them straight to our base of operations?
I don't know why, and I don't know how, but it looks that way.
It doesn't matter why or how. We've just got to clean up this mess before they reach the shore.
That's a suicide mission if I've ever heard of one.
It would be... but I've got a few tricks left up my sleeves.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
There's no end to them. They're crowding us.
It's looking bleak.
Now would be the perfect time for one of those tricks up your sleeve.
You're right... Okay, buy me time. I've got to get things set up. Here, get this armed and ready to take off.
Wait, this is another bomb. You had an extra?
They might've given us two. I was saving it for a rainy day. If I had told you about it, you would've used it by now.

Fields.MenuText: You give me so little credit.
You know me so well.
Keep this in mind when I start keeping secrets from you.

Fields.DialogueText: I give you just as much credit as you deserve.
I know you better than anyone. At least until those rumors start to spread around the ship.
You could never keep any secrets from me. I'm too inquisitive.
Just get going. I'll buy you as much time as I can, so you'd better put your plan into motion before we start sinking.
Yes, Captain. You'll know when to launch the bomb, I'm sure.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
This wave's huge - and there's apparently more coming to join the fun. Hurry up, Hermes. We won't survive at long at this rate.
Captain, we're taking some serious damage.
Tell me something I don't know. Concentrate on defense. We're trying to buy Hermes as much time as possible.
@BATTLE
We need to put out every fire we can - that Morgana supercluster's not more than half an hour out, and...
*plane taking off*
Well, that's a good sign.
Sorry I took so long, Captain.
I'm glad you're here.

Fields.MenuText: Now we can die together.
I hope your plan's coming together.
Unless I'm dead and this is heaven.

Fields.DialogueText: We're not going to die. Just watch the plane.
I'm... not sure yet. Just keep an eye on the plane.
If your idea of heaven is surrounded by an army of Morganas with me, then you're crazier than I thought.
What did the plane just drop? Is that... is that the fuel?
Highly flammable. We've still got plenty of barrels left if this works.
Wait... look at the Morganas. They're piling onto the Morganas covered in oil.
Are they... are they eating them?
I hope they're not combining into one super giant Morgana.
Don't even say that that. Just the idea is nightmare fuel, Captain.
The plane's coming back around.
Hold onto something.
*BOOM*
Are the Morganas... retreating?
The few that are left... yeah. That bomb obliterated most of them.
How did you know they'd all gang up on the one covered in oil?
I... I didn't. None of my experiments prepared me for a result like that.
Well... Aren't we the luckiest ship in the ocean.
This is a very intriguing new development. I'm glad we have so much of the substance left to examine.
Yes, well, I suggest you keep it all in a sealed environment. We're not sure how the Morganas sense it, so better safe than sorry.
Trust me, we know of all the precautions we need to take.
Excuse me, but isn't this kind of a failure now?
It might not work as fuel any longer, but it has qualities that could make it an excellent tool.
By qualities, I assume you mean that Morganas seem to be attracted to it?
Precisely.
How is that a useful quality?

Fields.MenuText: He wants to make a weapon.

Fields.DialogueText: What? How would attacking Morganas with something they like be a good weapon?
It's not a weapon to fight Morganas.
You're smarter than you look.
I intend to repurpose this "fuel" and develop it into something we can use against our enemies. For all intents and purposes, we'd be using the threat of Morganas as a weapon.
That sounds dangerous.
Is now really the best time to worry about fighting amongst ourselves?
I prefer to look at it as a way to bring humanity together by force.
I'm not sure I understand.
The only way we can defeat the Morganas is if humanity fights together. So far we continue to bicker while the Morganas thrive.
So if we must force the world to fight on the same side against the Morganas, using the threat of Morganas, so be it. It's better than the alternative.
I'm with Hermes. It sounds a little sketchy to me.
Fortunately, I'm the scientist here. And your superior. Don't you forget that.
*sigh* Yes, Captain. We understand.
Just don't blow up the world.
Thanks for taking my side, Captain.
You know I've always got your back. Especially with this kind of stuff. You're usually right.
*smile*
*ALARM*
Got time for a couple Morganas?
Always.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: He wants to make perfume.
He wants to drink it and become the first human Morgana.

Fields.DialogueText: A perfume? Well, I guess if you want to appeal to a Morgana... Personally I'd wear something a little more floral.
Would you? That sounds nice.
You think so? Hmm...
Are you two done?
Ah, sorry. You were saying?
I... don't think you understand how science works, Cap.
*KNOCK*
Come in!
Hey, Captain, are you busy?

Fields.MenuText: No, for once I have absolutely nothing on my plate.
I'm the captain, so I'm always busy.
Depends on what you're here for.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. I wanted to see if you wanted to do something with me.
Too busy even for me?
I was hoping you had time to... hang out with me.
Well, we've got our new experiment below deck and I was hoping you could help me examine it.
Oh, that's... so you.
Are you... disappointed?
No... well, I just kind of thought you meant... well, a date.
I did. Wasn't that obvious? Is that not datelike enough? I've never done this before. I've heard about this enough that you'd think I'd be an expert by now, but here I am-
Hey, it sounds like the perfect date. We can lick it and see how it tastes.
Heheh. I'll go first to make sure it's safe.
As long as you're not going to lie and try to trick me.
*ALARM*
I hate Morganas. I hate them so much.
They're not too bad. You're here because of them.
